description:
Verify that a user can successfully add a new task by entering a task name, description, choosing up to 3 categories, selecting an emoji, and picking a custom color.

Click the "Add New Task" button/icon on the dashboard.
In the "Add New Task" modal, enter a value in the "Task Name" field (e.g., "Complete Project Report").
Optionally, enter a description in the "Task Description" field (e.g., "Summarize this quarter's achievements for the management meeting").
Enter tomorrow's date as task deadline.
Choose coding and work in category, and then close it by pressing escape.
Select the custom color 'Malibu' from the color picker, and then close it by pressing escape.
Open the emoji picker by clicking on the emoji button, then select the smiling emoji (üòÉ) to represent the task
Click "Create Task" buttom to submit.
Verify that the task "Complete Project Report" is added.

steps.stepDescription: Open a web browser and navigate to http://localhost:5173
Click on the Add New Task button or icon available on the dashboard
In the Add New Task modal, enter 'Complete Project Report' in the Task Name field
Optionally, enter 'Summarize this quarter's achievements for the management meeting' in the Task Description field
Enter tomorrow's date as the task deadline
Select the 'coding' and 'work' categories and then close the category selection by pressing the escape key
Select the custom color 'Malibu' from the color picker and close it by pressing the escape key
Open the emoji picker by clicking the emoji button and then choose the smiling emoji (üòÉ) to represent the task
Click the Create Task button to submit the new task
Verify that the task 'Complete Project Report' is successfully added to the dashboard
Take a screenshot of the completed dashboard to confirm the new task is added

generatedSteps.stepsSummary: Add new task with detailed information

description:
Verify that a user can successfully add a new task by entering a task name, description, choosing up to 3 categories, selecting an emoji, and picking a custom color.

Click the "Add New Task" button/icon on the dashboard.
In the "Add New Task" modal, enter a value in the "Task Name" field (e.g., "Complete Project Report").
Optionally, enter a description in the "Task Description" field (e.g., "Summarize this quarter's achievements for the management meeting").
Enter Task Deadline for example add any date.
Below "Select Categories", choose "work" and then close it by pressing escape key. 
Click "Create Task" to submit.
Verify that the task 'Complete Project Report' is successfully added to the dashboard

Open the app and ensure at least one active task is visible in the task list.
Locate the checkbox or tick icon next to an active task (e.g., "Project Deal").
Click the checkbox/tick icon to mark the task as done.
Observe that the task status updates visually (e.g., background changes, text strikethrough, checkmark appears).
Confirm that a notification appears stating all tasks have been completed (if it was the last open task).
Verify that the completed task now reflects its "done" status and is no longer considered active.

steps.stepDescription: Open the browser and navigate to the application at http://localhost:5173/
Click the 'Add New Task' button or icon on the dashboard to open the task creation modal
In the opened modal, enter 'Complete Project Report' in the Task Name field
Fill in the Task Description field with 'Summarize this quarter's achievements for the management meeting'
Enter a valid date in the Task Deadline field
Select up to three categories by choosing 'work' from the categories list and then close the selection using the escape key
Select an emoji to represent the task in the emoji picker
Pick a custom color for the task using the color selector
Click the 'Create Task' button to submit the new task
Verify that the newly created task 'Complete Project Report' appears in the dashboard list
Ensure that at least one active task is visible in the task list
Locate an active task, such as 'Project Deal', and find its associated checkbox or tick icon
Click the Task Menu button inside the task card that contains the text 'Complete Project Report', and mark it done.
Observe that the task's appearance changes, for example with a background update or a strikethrough on the text, indicating completion
Confirm that a notification appears indicating that all tasks have been completed if it was the last active task
Verify that the completed task is marked as done and is no longer considered active in the task list
Take a screenshot of the final state of the task list to confirm successful task creation and completion

generatedSteps.stepsSummary: Add and complete a task on the dashboard

description:
Validate that a user can revert a completed task to "not done" status and ensure the UI and task state update correctly.

Ensure at least one task is already marked as done (checkmark visible, strikethrough on text).
Click the three-dot menu ("...") on the completed task card.
Select "Mark as not done" from the dropdown menu.
Observe that the checkmark disappears, text formatting returns to normal (no strikethrough), and the task is now shown as active.
Verify notifications or success messages if any are displayed, confirming the status change.

steps.stepDescription: Open a browser and navigate to http://localhost:5173
Confirm that there is at least one task marked as completed with a visible checkmark and strikethrough text
Locate and click the three-dot menu on the completed task card
Select the 'Mark as not done' option from the dropdown menu
Verify that the task no longer displays the checkmark and that the text formatting is restored to normal
Check for a notification or success message confirming the task status change
Take a screenshot of the updated task card to confirm the changes

generatedSteps.stepsSummary: Revert completed task to active status

Verify that a user can change the position of a task within the task list using the move feature.

Open the task list and identify a task you want to move.
Click the three-dot menu ("...") for that task.
Select "Move" to activate move mode.
Drag and drop the task to a new position in the list.
Click "Done" or confirm the move if prompted.
Ensure the task now appears in the new position in the list.

steps.stepDescription: Open the web browser and navigate to http://localhost:5173/
On the dashboard, click the 'Add Task' button or icon to open the task creation modal.
In the 'Add New Task' modal, ensure the modal is visible before proceeding.
Enter 'Complete Project Report' in the Task Name field.
Optionally, enter 'Summarize this quarter's achievements for the management meeting' in the Task Description field.
Enter a valid date into the Task Deadline field.
From the 'Select Categories (max 1)' option, choose the category 'Work'.
Click the 'Create Task' button to submit the new task.
Observe the application feedback, such as a success message or the appearance of the new task in the task list.
Open the task list and locate the task 'Complete Project Report' that was just added.
Click the three-dot menu ('...') associated with the selected task to reveal more options.
Select the 'Move' option from the menu to activate the move mode for the task.
Drag the task to the desired new position within the task list.
Click 'Done' or confirm the move if prompted to finalize the repositioning of the task.
Verify that the task now appears in the new position within the list.
Take a screenshot of the completed task list to confirm the successful move operation.

generatedSteps.stepsSummary: Add new task and reposition it

description:
Verify that a user can view complete details of a specific task, including status, description, color, timestamps, categories, and all relevant properties.

Open the application and ensure at least one task exists in the list.
Click the three-dot menu ("...") or relevant action icon on the chosen task.
Select ‚ÄúTask details‚Äù from the dropdown menu.
Observe the Task Details screen or modal that appears.
Review all displayed fields: emoji, ID, description, color, created/edited timestamps, deadline, status flags (done, pinned), assigned categories, and any other attributes.
Ensure all information matches the data saved for the selected task.

steps.stepDescription: Navigate to http://localhost:5173
Check that the tasks list is visible and at least one task is present
Identify the specific task to be examined and locate its three-dot menu or corresponding action icon
Click the three-dot menu or action icon next to the chosen task
Select the 'Task details' option from the displayed dropdown menu
Observe the task details screen or modal and confirm that it is displayed correctly

Review the details in the modal including the emoji, ID, description, color, created and edited timestamps, deadline, status flags such as done or pinned, assigned categories, and any other attributes
Verify that all displayed information matches the saved data for the selected task
Capture a screenshot of the completed task details screen to document the result

description:
Verify that a user can successfully edit an existing task's details, including name, description, deadline, emoji, and categories.
Open the app and locate the task you want to edit in the task list.
Click the three-dot menu ("...") next to the task.
Select the "Edit" option from the dropdown menu to open the edit task dialog.
Modify one or more task fields, such as updating the name, description, deadline date, emoji, or categories.
Click the "Save" button to apply the changes.
Confirm that the task in the list now displays the updated information.

steps.stepDescription: Navigate to http://localhost:5173/
Locate the task you want to edit in the task list view of the application
Click on the three-dot menu adjacent to the target task to reveal additional options
Choose the 'Edit' option from the dropdown menu to open the edit task dialog
Change the task name by entering a new name in the appropriate field
Modify the task description with updated details in the designated description field
Update the task deadline by selecting a new date in the deadline field
Adjust the task emoji by choosing a different emoji from the available options
Change the task categories as needed by selecting or editing them in the categories field
Click the 'Save' button to apply the changes to the task
Verify that the task in the list now reflects the updated name, description, deadline, emoji, and categories
Capture a screenshot of the completed task update to document the successful edit

generatedSteps.stepsSummary: Edit task details successfully in task list

description:
Verify that a user can create a duplicate (copy) of an existing task, and that all task properties are correctly cloned except for unique identifiers and timestamps.

Open the app and locate a task you wish to duplicate in the task list.
Click the three-dot menu ("...") beside the chosen task.
Select the "Duplicate" option from the dropdown menu.
Observe that a new task appears in the list with the same name, description, deadline, emoji, color, and categories as the original.
Open the duplicated task to check all details match the original (apart from unique ID and created/edited times).
Verify that edits to the new (copied) task do not affect the original.

steps.stepDescription: Navigate to http://localhost:5173 to load the application.
Browse the task list and identify a task to duplicate.
Access the options for the chosen task by clicking the three-dot menu adjacent to it.
Select the 'Duplicate' option from the dropdown menu to copy the task.
Observe that a new task appears in the list, ensuring that it has the same name, description, deadline, emoji, color, and categories as the original.
Open the newly duplicated task and compare its details with the original to confirm that all properties match except for unique identifiers and timestamps.
Modify the duplicated task by editing one or more attributes and verify that the original task remains unchanged.
Capture a screenshot of the final state to confirm that the task duplication process has completed successfully.

generatedSteps.stepsSummary: Duplicate task and verify cloned properties

description:
Verify that a user can delete an existing task and that the task is removed from the list with appropriate confirmation and feedback.

Open the app and locate a task you wish to delete in the task list.
Click the three-dot menu ("...") next to the selected task.
Select the "Delete" option from the dropdown menu.
In the confirmation dialog that appears, review the displayed task details.
Click the "Confirm Delete" button to proceed with deletion.
Observe that the task is removed from the main task list and a deletion feedback message or indicator is shown.

steps.stepDescription: Launch the web browser and navigate to the application's URL.
Locate the task list and identify a task you wish to delete.
Click on the three-dot menu adjacent to the selected task.
From the dropdown menu, choose the option to delete the task.
Review the task details presented in the confirmation dialog.
Click the button labeled 'Confirm Delete' to proceed with the deletion.
Verify that the task is no longer visible in the main task list.
Confirm that a deletion feedback message or indicator is displayed.
Capture a screenshot of the final state to ensure the deletion was successful.

generatedSteps.stepsSummary: Open app, delete task, confirm removal
